reviewText:
Pro's: The game is beautiful. Even on medium settings the game looks great and runs smoothly. The story is actually enthralling and is keeping me interested and I don't find myself speeding through text and skipping cinematics. Atleast, not for the main stories lol. The monsters are really well done and there are a wide variety from cute and cuddly (i.e the Cactus monster thing...) to the scary *** demons.

The dungeons are fun and it seems that most of them tie in with the main story so you in a sense have to unlock them. Same goes with getting your first chocobo

Cons: There are some things that really do bug me in this game which may be just superficial on my part. The first is how the map is. When zoomed out to look at a regional view all you see are name blocks with lines directing which zones are connected. It's not like a google map view that you find in most mmo's. Along with that is trying to find where to go with quests. Some mmos if you have quest lets say 3 zones over, will usually point you to the nearest exit from the current zone into the next. This game doesnt seem to do that. If you have a quest in one zone over, sure it will show you. But if it is 2 zones over then you need to go and track it down.

The zones themselvs I wish were not instanced. Even parts of the main cities are instanced. I personally like complete open world games. Or at the very least, the main cities should not be broken into instances.

Getting a mount is kind of a pain. You need to progress to roughly lvl 20 before you get the quest to get a mount. Then you need to go farm some tokens in order to get a certificate. That part isnt necessarily hard just annoying. Even if you have the collectors edition and have the two mounts already, you need to get the normal chocobo first before you can use them.

My biggest gripe however, is the use/lack there of of voice over for the games. Some main story cinematics will have voice overs, some dont. Some times you will have voices then all of a sudden you dont. It's not my sound card, or computer, or whatever, it's the developers that didnt put in voice acting for the whole game. I hope they do add in more sometime down the line.

Overall though this is a very well done game and I am impressed. Even with the nuances I am enjoying the game immensly and definitely recommend playing it even if it's just the trial.

reviewText:
I got this game a month ago.... My life has been taken over.


But in all seriousness, this game is fantastic. I've played a lot of mmo's during my years of computer gaming and I have never once had the real patience to grind through them to reach the end game. This game however has held my attention from start to finish, the cutscenes and dialog are all very well done for the story and this game is just very engaging to me.

Clearly since this game is an MMORPG it does take a bit of grinding here and there to get the the end game stuff, but let me tell you once you get to endgame it all starts there. There is so much to do at the end game its rediculous. I still havent gotten anywhere close to finishing it. I've only just scratched the surface of my Relic weapon not to mention only just beating the First Coil of Bahamut....damn T9. And the primal fights are just a fun way to pass time when you feel like making a farm party for them. Tbh just about everything in the endgame is incredibly fun, to me anyway, and will keep you busy for quite a long time. Not too mention this game is very friendly to Casual players as well as Hardcore ones. The combat itself in the game pretty much easy straight through the whole game till the end game. Casual players can find themselves just hanging around talking with people in the community or just maybe running some dungeons for loot or fun, While Hardcore players can find themselves getting engrosed in the endgame constantly trying to get that Primal or Turn clear, as well as farming several endgame raids and bosses all to get that one piece of gear they want.

Additionally you don't even need to level a combat class specifically. I know quite a few people who were so engrossed in crafting and gathering that they maxed a few of those classes before even hitting level 50 with a combat class.

Speaking of combat, in this game personally I feel that they did the combat right. Everything feels very easy about the combat and the moves and combos flow together very nicely, it doesnt feel clunky.

This is all I have to say for now, and I very highly reccommend this game to anyone who loves MMORPG's and is a fan of Final Fantasy.

Also, F**K you Titan Ex, I have cleared you once and never again shall I attempt your annoyingness.

reviewText:
After what i feel is a decent amount of hours played i feel i can write a review for this game..

Lets start with its good points right? so here goes:-
FF XIV is a top shelf MMORPG, yes your have to purchase the base game and yes it has a subscription fee 'sigh'... but after much deliberation and playing pretty much every other MMORPG.  My friend and I came to the conclusion that in F2P games the most important content and utilities where microtransaction BS! and you just cannot progress.. not to mention the most vile and hatred filled gamers your ever likely to come across.. So we gave this one a bash and in all honesty for what your paying its a bargain ! and no im not a fan boy.. im speaking the truth.... theres no locked content, everything is available as long as your able to progress that far and level up high enough to reach the locations.

The graphics in this game are indeed Direct X9.0, but not by any means outdated ! i play many new games such as S.O.M / Farcry 4 etc... and this game is just as graphically pleasing if not a little easier on the eye as it all blends and texturises realy well. I run a Nvidia Geforce GT 740 2GB ddr5 card and get 40-50 fps all day long on the highest settings.

The music is well composed and fits in well with the FF Franchise to those who are familiar, however just sometimes it can grate on you when your not expecting it or suddenly gets louder...
Voice acting is some what scarce and when is around poorly dubbed but again something anyone familiar with FF will just over look this easily !

As for content the game is full of it ! Theres never a dull moment, with 18 Classes to not only choose from but swap to at any given moment you can never get bored... ive litterally gone from fighting to keep my A** alive to suddenly sat on a stool fishing for sardines !! all in space of a few seconds. get bored of fishing easy ?? no problem grab a pickaxe and follow me ! we can go smash some crountry side open and mine for ore and composites !! whats that you say ?? cant find your pickaxe ?? not to worry my friend, lets go train to become a carpenter. We'll have you equipped in no time :D and how about after that we head to the Culinary Guild and cook us up a nice dinner of rabbit pie with white pearl chocolates for afterwards.

Like a bit of slash and gash voilence ? become a Gladiator and Tank your way through whiles the Arcanist's and the Thurmatages watch your back with ranged magic and summons ...

And of course need not to be mentioned really (ITS AN MMO ITS IN THE DESCRIPTION) you can do this with your friends 95% of the way through... of course i say 95% because during some Guild missions and Campaigns missions im afraid your going to have to go it alone !!! But the people of Eorzea are a nice Folk and are willing to help out anyone who just speaks up !! Help is out there people.. your never alone here :D FF XIV is Cross-Platform compatible with the PC/PS3/PS4 platforms and you play along side them..

Bad Points to this game:-

Again i say Subscriptions fees" but there not all that bad .. theres no locked content once you've paid and everything is at some point readily available..

Fast Travel can cost a fortune so be wary of how you travel !

Can seem Tedious at times
date:
but once you discover everything there is to do youll never fit it all into a day :D


Overall i Can definetly recommend this game to anyone looking for an MMORPG but feel there all missing something ??
WELL WHAT DO YOU EXPECT FOR FREE HUH ??? pay a little and gain alot more !

9.3/10 theres always room for improvement right ??

Come join us today and find out for yourself just how addictive and fun this game really is ..... because you just cant take someones else word for it :D"

reviewText:
9/10 Im going to keep this brief. I feel this game is solid enough to be a top contender in the MMO genre and worth the monthly fee it charges. FF14 is an amazing story based MMO that is quite unique in many ways. There is so much to do story wise that all I can say is check it out. If you can get on a full server like Gilgamesh and Cactuar this game is honestly 10/10. There are always people running around and you will never really find yourself alone. There are many jobs/classes to level so your character can quite literally be anything. For me this was a massive selling point as I feel its pretty awesome to be able to play any role I want at any time on just one character.

EDIT:
With all that being said I want it to be known I have played many MMOs and rarely do I enjoy any other than WOW. I have played through Wildstar, ESO, GW, GW2 and many others. I usually find myself going back to WOW after a few months of playing a new MMO and reaching end game. I am seriously considering making this my main MMO if PvP gets better.

All in all I would say get this game no matter what on a sale. It comes with a free month witch is enough time to decide whether or not you would enjoy the game.

Long time FF fans this game is a must for you. It stays true to the roots and has quite alot of nostalgia  if you have played through the Final Fantasy games.

reviewText:
Of all the MMOs I've  played, and I have played a good number of them, this is one that sticks out as the game that truly has kept me coming back for more after this much time.  On top of that, I've been playing MMOs for so long that I've played a good number of times with subs and non sub games and I sort of got burnt out on subbed games just because none of them seemed to keep my attention long enough to make the payment per month worth it.  In spite of that, FFXIV: ARR is one that I actually returned to even with a sub, because it is well worth the money.

More specifically, FFXIV is for one, a very beautiful game and although graphics alone cannot make a game great, it is a factor at least for me.  Even if a game has great gameplay without decent graphics I probably won't remain interested.  The opposite is true too but in the case of this game, it has good gameplay mechanics along with absolutely stunning graphics.

The stories, let's face it, many times a lot of mmo players skip through the dialog and story to get to more quests and level up fast and while I'll admit there is some of that with FFXIV, for the most part, I find myself interested in reading and enjoying the main story more than most other games of the same genre.

Aside from those things, the class system, the ability to learn multiple classes and the jobs are detailed and interesting enough to really make it stand out for me.  I love that the crafting isn't a simplifed style where it's just click and create like so many other mmos have done.

There is far more I can say about this game that I love but you get the gist of things I hope.  If you're an MMO fan, looking to try something new it is absolutely worth your time to at least give it a try.

reviewText:
Ok. First of all I am not an MMORPG fan. I Have played 2 before and not for very long. I swore I would NEVER pay for a subscription fee.

Now I have paid for one and do not regret it at all.
This game is awesome. The amount of stuff you can do in game is impressive as are the graphics and framerate if your PC can handle it.  I have so far played as 2 different classes and to me they feel different. I play them different, which is a good thing.

People are generally pretty helpful to noobs and not total d1ckfaces, Although you do get some of those too to be fair.
The community seems to be pretty tightly knit and friendly. Within a few minutes on each of 2 servers I have played on, I have been invited to join Free Companys. Or Guilds if you prefer.

There does seem to be a fairly steep learning curve with menus and such, and the game doesn't really explain them very well if at all. Stick with it, ask questions and experiment and after a while you will get the hang of it.

The map can be daunting at times. I find I'm getting better at it all of the time, but initially it can really mess you up. Especially when there can be different height levels in some areas such as towns. The map does not shift up or down to accomodate your vantage point.

When playing with a party, it seems you will share/split experience. That can be pretty cool.

Audio is good and has some classic FF music, which is nice.
Graphics are incredibly vibrant and colorful, like you'd expect from a FF game.

Character interactions are a little tedious. You read alsmot EVERYTHING. Even most cutscenes are not voiced. Although there are a few.

Account creation is a  little weird. Especially when you have to use the game client+the website+subscribe and link your account. This could have been a little less confusing.

When a friend wants to join you and they just got  the game it is entirely possible that they may not be able to join you. The  world you are on might be full. They can't wait for someone just to logoff. That doesn't seem to work. They have to hope that someone deletes a character at some point I have a lvl 12 character in one world and my friend cannot join me. I had to create a new character on a new world to play with them.

One last thing: I believe, (and I might be wrong about this), that you get 8 character slots per world. To give you an idea, there are roughly 8 worlds per server area and about 7 server areas. That is pretty impressive.

Would I recommend this game to people? Sure if you are a Final Fantasy fan or an MMO fan.
Not for everybody...but I'm loving it so far.

reviewText:
Pro's: The game is beautiful. Even on medium settings the game looks great and runs smoothly. The story is actually enthralling and is keeping me interested and I don't find myself speeding through text and skipping cinematics. Atleast, not for the main stories lol. The monsters are really well done and there are a wide variety from cute and cuddly (i.e the Cactus monster thing...) to the scary *** demons.

The dungeons are fun and it seems that most of them tie in with the main story so you in a sense have to unlock them. Same goes with getting your first chocobo

Cons: There are some things that really do bug me in this game which may be just superficial on my part. The first is how the map is. When zoomed out to look at a regional view all you see are name blocks with lines directing which zones are connected. It's not like a google map view that you find in most mmo's. Along with that is trying to find where to go with quests. Some mmos if you have quest lets say 3 zones over, will usually point you to the nearest exit from the current zone into the next. This game doesnt seem to do that. If you have a quest in one zone over, sure it will show you. But if it is 2 zones over then you need to go and track it down.

The zones themselvs I wish were not instanced. Even parts of the main cities are instanced. I personally like complete open world games. Or at the very least, the main cities should not be broken into instances.

Getting a mount is kind of a pain. You need to progress to roughly lvl 20 before you get the quest to get a mount. Then you need to go farm some tokens in order to get a certificate. That part isnt necessarily hard just annoying. Even if you have the collectors edition and have the two mounts already, you need to get the normal chocobo first before you can use them.

My biggest gripe however, is the use/lack there of of voice over for the games. Some main story cinematics will have voice overs, some dont. Some times you will have voices then all of a sudden you dont. It's not my sound card, or computer, or whatever, it's the developers that didnt put in voice acting for the whole game. I hope they do add in more sometime down the line.

Overall though this is a very well done game and I am impressed. Even with the nuances I am enjoying the game immensly and definitely recommend playing it even if it's just the trial.

reviewText:
This game has some interesting mechanics that help it stand out. First off, the multiclassing system is pretty neat. At around level 10 your character gains the ability to level up in other classes simply by equipping the weapon associated with that class. All of your stats and gear can also be independently associated with those other classes, which basically means that other than race, gender, or name, you can experience all the content of the game with just one character.

The graphics are quite nice, although not spectacular. The textures are a bit soft and the game has a fairly stylistic, cartoony feel. However, aesthetically the game is beautiful. There's not a single ugly character to be found anywhere, except perhaps the giant or tiny races, and that just depends on your taste.

Combat doesn't stray far from standard Diku-MUD" style tab-targeting / hotbar combat like you'd find in almost any other MMO since EQ. They do manage to mix it up a bit

reviewText:
A Year in review of Final Fantasy XIV

-Content-
You get more than your moneys worth you get many jobs to level you have crafting which I can say my brother he’s no lifed for weeks on end, There is the now full Binding of Coils of Bahamut Raids to participate in if you want a challenge, There is also the three part 24 man Crystal Tower Raids, Summoned Beasts known as Primals each taken from the summons from previous Final Fantasy games are here to challenge your resolve from Ifrit to Odin!, and HOURS worth of story to enjoy and speculate on. Want to prove dedication to you chosen job? Work on a relic its at least 3-4 weeks of content to do to get a beautiful looking top tier weapon.

-Graphics-
For an MMO the game is beautiful lush green landscapes of Gridania, the mountainous plains of Limsa Lominsa, and the scorching deserts of Thanalan. Each of these environments are flushed out with amazing textures for a game in this genre.

-Gameplay-
You get two options to fit how you choose to play keyboard and mouse or controller both are equally viable options I personally use a controller its literally the most amazing thing to play an mmo effectively with a controller square nael'd it (puns!)

-Community-
It’s the same thing everywhere in any online game you get those people who are way to competitive for their own good and take this game way to seriously. There is free companies which is the Guild" system in this game start one with your friends and build a community or find one you fit into. Who knows you might find someone special I know I did :3

-Overall-
I have spent way too much time I care to admit to in this game I just cant fuly get bored of it because I keep coming up with new goals to work on there really is alot to do and there will be even more to do when we get to Ishgard in Heavensward!

10/10"

reviewText:
FFXIV:ARR is my first full experience with an MMO.  I tried XI, but found the learning curve and controls to be more that I had the patience to deal with.  XIV is casual and controller friendly, but most importantly to me, it's a Great Final Fantasy game.

The game does the standard Tank | Healer | DPS trinity and knowing your role is important.  If you Don't Rush through the story to lvl 50, there's enough opportunity to become familiar with your role(s) of choice, and plenty to do after your first 50.

A single character can be (level) every class in the game and is based on (gains experience with) Weapon/Tool in hand.  As you level each class, you gain skills that can be shared in select other classes.  In addition to classes, there are jobs which provide unique skills.  Jobs can be acquired when a Primary class reaches 30 and a secondary class reaches 15.  This is all explained in-game.

In addition to the fighting classes, there are crafting and gathering classes.  I initially had NO Interest in this, but at one point decided I'd try my hand at one of them.  IF you enjoy it, it's ridiculously addictive.  If you find it tedious, leave it to those who don't.

Story, Graphics, Gameply... I'm loving them all.  I've been playing since Aug 26th 2013 and to date immensely enjoy this game.

reviewText:
FInal Fantasy XIV ARR is by far one of the best MMORPGs I have ever played!
I'm not going to list all the MMORPG games I have played as I will be here for ages, but I will say I have been playing MMORPGs for over a decade! (wow I just realised that).

From a Final Fantasy Fan perspective: I am a huge Final Fantasy series fan and this does the series justice! I was worried about how it turned out originally before they did the remake, and now that the devs have their heads on straight it is absolutely amazing!

From an MMORPG player perspective: One of the many key features I love about this game as an MMORPG in general is; You can have as many classes/jobs and crafts as you want on ONE character!
There are so many games out there that just dont adpot this simple yet extremely appealing feature! So many times I have wanted to just be ONE character - build up a story for that ONE character - and not have to make loads of other characters just to experience different classes/jobs and crafts. If you prefer to have different characters for different classes/jobs and crafts then you can still do that! So it really does appeal and accomodate to both sides.

There are so many amazing features about this game that really makes this MMORPG stand up above the rest but the best way to understand it is to experience it for yourself. Otherwise I would be here typing this post until my fingers bleed.

One final thing I will say is that if you are a fan of the Final Fantasy series then I would recommend this game 100%! If you have never played any of the Final Fantasy series then I would still recommend this game 100%!

Happy hunting everyone!
